THE DECEASED PERSON'S GRANDFATHERS AND GRANDMOTHERS AND THEIR DESCENDANTS
(1) A grandfather and grandmother on the same side shall inherit equal portions.
(2) If one of the ancestors on one side has died prior to the decedent, the portion of the estate that he or she would have been entitled to had he or she survived the decedent shall be inherited by his or her children, grandchildren or any further descendants, in accordance with the rules that apply in the case of the inheritance of the decedent's children and other descendants.
(3) In all other cases, the rules that apply to the inheritance of the decedent's parents and their descendants shall also apply to the succession right of his or her grandparents on a particular side and their descendants.
